intro: Phyllanthus ningaensis, commonly known as the African spurge, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It is a shrub that typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is characterized by its small, green leaves and yellow flowers. The plant belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is known for its latex-producing properties. It has a compact growth habit and is often found in disturbed soils or along roadsides. Its botanical features make it an important species in ecological studies and traditional medicine.
